t: John 9
And*p as Jesus passed by, he saw a man which was blind from his birth.
And*p his disciples asked him, saying, Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?
Jesus*p answered, Neither*r hath*r this*r man*r sinned,*r nor*r his*r parents:*r but*r that*r the*r works*r of*r God*r should*r be*r made*r manifest*r in*r him.*r
I*rp must*r work*r the*r works*r of*r him*r that*r sent*r me,*r while*r it*r is*r day:*r the*r night*r cometh,*r when*r no*r man*r can*r work.*r
As*rp long*r as*r I*r am*r in*r the*r world,*r I*r am*r the*r light*r of*r the*r world.*r
When*p he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay,
And*p said unto him, Go,*r wash*r in*r the*r pool*r of*r Siloam,*r (which is by interpretation, Sent.) He went his way therefore, and washed, and came seeing.
The*p neighbours therefore, and they which before had seen him that he was blind, said, Is not this he that sat and begged?
Some*p said, This is he: others said, He is like him: but he said, I am he.
Therefore*p said they unto him, How were thine eyes opened?

He*p answered and said, A man that is called Jesus made clay, and anointed mine eyes, and said unto me, Go*r to*r the*r pool*r of*r Siloam,*r and*r wash:*r and I went and washed, and I received sight.
Then*p said they unto him, Where is he? He said, I know not.
They*p brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.
And*p it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.
Then*p again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He said unto them, He put clay upon mine eyes, and I washed, and do see.

Therefore*p said some of the Pharisees, This man is not of God, because he keepeth not the sabbath day. Others said, How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles? And there was a division among them.
They*p say unto the blind man again, What sayest thou of him, that he hath opened thine eyes? He said, He is a prophet.
But*p the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight.
And*p they asked them, saying, Is this your son, who ye say was born blind? how then doth he now see?
His*p parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:
But*p by what means he now seeth, we know not; or who hath opened his eyes, we know not: he is of age; ask him: he shall speak for himself.
These*p words spake his parents, because they feared the Jews: for the Jews had agreed already, that if any man did confess that he was Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.
Therefore*p said his parents, He is of age; ask him.
Then*p again called they the man that was blind, and said unto him, Give God the praise: we know that this man is a sinner.
He*p answered and said, Whether he be a sinner or no, I know not: one thing I know, that, whereas I was blind, now I see.
Then*p said they to him again, What did he to thee? how opened he thine eyes?
He*p answered them, I have told you already, and ye did not hear: wherefore would ye hear it again? will ye also be his disciples?
Then*p they reviled him, and said, Thou art his disciple; but we are Moses' disciples.
We*p know that God spake unto Moses: as for this fellow, we know not from whence he is.
The*p man answered and said unto them, Why herein is a marvellous thing, that ye know not from whence he is, and yet he hath opened mine eyes.
Now*p we know that God heareth not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and doeth his will, him he heareth.
Since*p the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind.
If*p this man were not of God, he could do nothing.
They*p answered and said unto him, Thou wast altogether born in sins, and dost thou teach us? And they cast him out.
Jesus*p heard that they had cast him out; and when he had found him, he said unto him, Dost*r thou*r believe*r on*r the*r Son*r of*r God?*r
He*p answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?
And*p Jesus said unto him, Thou*r hast*r both*r seen*r him,*r and*r it*r is*r he*r that*r talketh*r with*r thee.*r
And*p he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.
And*p Jesus said, For*r judgment*r I*r am*r come*r into*r this*r world,*r that*r they*r which*r see*r not*r might*r see;*r and*r that*r they*r which*r see*r might*r be*r made*r blind.*r
And*p some of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words, and said unto him, Are we blind also?
Jesus*p said unto them, If*r ye*r were*r blind,*r ye*r should*r have*r no*r sin:*r but*r now*r ye*r say,*r We*r see;*r therefore*r your*r sin*r remaineth.*r
